description:
Berthel Fisher offers comprehensive benefits including:
Health, dental and vision insurance
401(k) program
Employer paid life insurance
Paid vacation, paid sick leave, paid holidays, and paid birthday leave
Employer paid short term and long-term disability coverage
Opportunity for career growth
On site exercise facility
We offer a great working environment in a beautiful and professional office location. This is your opportunity to play a key role in the continued success of our company. Our culture is fast-paced, motivational and focused on improving our client’s lives.
Please check back often for new opportunities to join the Berthel Fisher Family. Or send a cover letter and resume to humanresources@berthel.com

Join Our Team!

We have the opportunity for a self-motivated, professional individual to assume the role of

Vice President of Business Development. The primary responsibility of the Vice President of

Business Development is to facilitate the growth of Berthel Fisher Companies by engaging with

and attracting Financial Professionals. The Vice President of Business Development plays an

important role in setting the impression of our organization. Duties include, but are not limited

to:

Collaborate with management and internal marketing department to establish and execute

recruiting campaigns, retention plans, and acquisition strategies

Recruit and acquire new Financial Professionals via phone, email and in person

conversations

Coordinate with Business Development department to communicate across the organization

throughout the recruiting and transition process

Develop relationships with third party recruiting firms

Organize and track data using various systems

Build and maintain relationships with previously recruited Financial Professionals

Qualified candidates will have previous experience in the Financial Services industry. FINRA

Securities Licenses 7 and/or 65 are required. Willingness to obtain additional FINRA or Sate

Licenses as required.

Desired candidates will present themselves professionally and have excellent written and oral

communication skills. Candidate must have excellent attention to detail and organizational skills

and must be self-motivated.

This position requires up to 50% travel.

Remote work is an option for candidates outside of the local area. Travel to the Cedar Rapids,

Iowa office would be required periodically.

Compensation: $80,000-100,000 base salary with recruiting incentive. This range is a good

faith estimate of the compensation to be offered for this position based on the ideal candidate’s

qualifications, the Company’s operational needs, and other considerations permitted by law.

The actual pay offered to a specific candidate may vary above or below the stated range.
